Text:
A few days after receiving the assignment from
Alpha...
Excuse my intrusion, Lady Alpha!

Come in. You look refreshed. I'm guessing you came up
with a solution.

Indeed! I wanted to let you know our organizational
structure moving forward!
By all means, please tell me.
Sir! Yes sir! Well then—

We should continue to maintain a rigorous amount of
training. Core strength is essential.

That said, we will not demand more training than is
necessary. Forcing the members to take on too much
may demoralize them.

Hmm. So far, it's business as usual... If anything,
it just sounds like you're going easier on training.
Anything else?

Yes, moving forward, I would like to put in place a
system that centers around teamwork.
...I see.

I will be teaching coordinated tactics in the future.
We have recently resumed training, having introduced
three-women units for trial.

Under this new framework, there has been an increase
in training efficiency due to rivalries stemming from
fellow members. There has also been an increase
in combat power within platoon units.

Furthermore, we have even seen units defeat enhanced
golems and slimes that were made to be unbeatable.
Thus, it's safe to say the results have been
positive.

...It has also resulted in a higher survival rate
which was my hope.
Your thoughts, Lady Alpha?

Those are excellent results, Lambda. It sounds like a
promising direction that balances your aim with the
will of the soldiers.

Beyond individual strengths, I had thought we should
increase our organizational strengths as the Shadow
Garden...but it looks like I didn't need to tell you
that.
Th-Then...?!

Yes, you've cleared the assignment. Good job,
Lambda. You did well.

Lady Alpha... Thank you! It's unlikely I would have
found a solution to this assignment alone.

Maybe so. But that's nothing to be ashamed of...
I'm sure you realize now.
Shadow told me something similar once.
Did he...?! What did he say?

It was a metaphor called "Three Arrows." You know...
it would be easier if I just showed you…

Saying this, Alpha creates a single arrow out of
slime and snaps it effortlessly.

...You see. It's easy to snap when it's just a
single arrow. In fact, it doesn't have to be an
arrow, but you get the point.

If you increase it to three arrows and try to break
them together, oddly enough, they don't snap easily.

I see! You can replace the arrows with people, and
it's the same logic!

Yes, exactly. When you put three arrows together like
this, they won't snap—
Alpha's strength snaps the three arrows.
...They snapped.

A-Anyway, it's just a metaphor! This sort of thing
can happen!
...Heheh.

Hey, don't laugh so much... I didn't mean to snap
them.
M-My apologies!

Anyway, if the trainees support each other, it will
make them stronger and tougher... That's what
I meant to say.

But it can be harder to work as an organization than
as an individual. Teamwork is no walk in the park,
either. If it seems they're close to their breaking
point, then—
Yes, then...
...I will become the fourth arrow and support them.
And so, Lambda continued to grow as an instructor.
